config.question: Those people accused of being witches in Salem were generally __________.

choices.content: from families associated with Salem’s burgeoning market economy
from the poorer and more uneducated segments of the town
notorious for their deviation from the moral norms of the community
outspoken opponents of the Puritan clergy

answer_3.response: No one knows exactly what sparked the terror in Salem Village. The community had a history of religious discord, and during the 1680s the people split into angry factions over the choice of a minister. Economic tensions also played a part. Poorer, more traditional farmers accused members of prosperous, commercially oriented families of being witches.
